name: D. Numbers
statement:
Furik loves writing all sorts of problems, especially such that he can’t
solve himself. You’ve got one of his problems, the one Furik gave to
Rubik. And Rubik asks you to solve it.There is integer and array ,
consisting of ten integers, indexed by numbers from 0 to 9. Your task is
to count the number of positive integers with the following properties:
the number’s length does not exceed ; the number doesn’t have leading
zeroes; digit occurs in the number at least times.
